title: So much for being “honourable”
author: VD
content_html:
It appears that Prince Andrew has belatedly realized that corrupt Cainites running interference for their elite counterparts are no longer in charge of the FBI and the DOJ:

Prince Andrew is still refusing to cooperate with a federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein’s alleged co-conspirators — despite a public pledge to do so, federal prosecutors said Monday.

“Contrary to Prince Andrew’s very public offer to cooperate with our investigation into Epstein’s co-conspirators, an offer that was conveyed via press release, Prince Andrew has now completely shut the door on voluntary cooperation,” US Attorney for the Southern District of New York Geoffrey Berman said late Monday morning after an unrelated press conference.

Andrew — the royal family black sheep who’s been slammed for his friendship with Epstein, and accused of raping one of Epstein’s victims — has reportedly hired Britain’s “most formidable” extradition lawyer to defend him against the federal probe.

No one ever said the prince was particularly bright. But he’s probably got enough of a survival instinct to realize that he’ll end up like his good buddy Epstein – who did not kill himself – if he’s arrested.

It appears that Prince Andrew has belatedly realized that corrupt Cainites running interference for their elite counterparts
are no longer in charge
of the FBI and the DOJ:
Prince Andrew is still refusing to cooperate with a federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein’s alleged co-conspirators — despite a public pledge to do so, federal prosecutors said Monday.
“Contrary to Prince Andrew’s very public offer to cooperate with our investigation into Epstein’s co-conspirators, an offer that was conveyed via press release, Prince Andrew has now completely shut the door on voluntary cooperation,” US Attorney for the Southern District of New York Geoffrey Berman said late Monday morning after an unrelated press conference.
Andrew — the royal family black sheep who’s been slammed for his friendship with Epstein, and accused of raping one of Epstein’s victims — has reportedly hired Britain’s “most formidable” extradition lawyer to defend him against the federal probe.
No one ever said the prince was particularly bright. But he’s probably got enough of a survival instinct to realize that he’ll end up like his good buddy Epstein – who did not kill himself – if he’s arrested.
